captions.text: Coming in to Barcelona and coming to visit the Barcelona academy,
it definitely helps because it inspires.
All the kind of things that we are trying to achieve are things that obviously Barcelona academy does.
Our idea of football is very clear to understand.
Basically, we aim for ball possession,
it allows you to attack and the opponent can’t attack you.
Although it may sound simple, based on this idea
we structure all of our methodology, our work and our exercises.
When we scout for players or actually select players,
what we first observe is whether boys are talented,
they have technique and they can interpret our idea
of ensuring maximum ball possession.
Then we will look for physical features,
but it’s very unlikely we would do it the other way round.
What makes us different from other clubs around the world…
The training sessions you can see for our teenagers
are pretty much the same as those of the first team.
So this makes it easier for us
and when a player gets to the top,
they perfectly understand the club’s methodology.
The exercises we are going to do today with the Nike Academy
are position games.
They consist of two teams of four,
with three pivots, so that it will always be 7 vs 4.
We always play in small spaces,
as mentally you are compelled to be very quick.
We try to make the transition defence-attack very short
but for it to be short, we have to be well situated,
which is the goal of these exercises.
Coming to Barcelona, it does make a difference.
These players are now quite excited because they’ve seen it through all the coaches, all the voices

and I think that’s quite powerful for the players.
